title: Is globalization beneficial for mom and pop stores (small businesses)? - Quora

response.answer_text: Never. Or, for that matter, any small businesses. Globalization was and is part of the 1% agenda to enrich property owners - owners of transnationals and very, very rich individuals with investments, not earned salaries, all over the world. Both want no economic or legal borders so they can slush their money around as they see fit. Incidentally, globalization might reduce costs for consumers, if you believe that buying Chinese crap is a real bargain. Because middle class incomes have not gone up like that of property owners, we strive to survive by buying cheap crap that wears out because it is cheap and shiny.
